TITLE: EPA orders dioxin testing at Ohio train crash site
SUMMARY: The order followed weeks of complaints by local residents that EPA wasn’t testing for dioxins, which can form when vinyl chloride is burned.

TITLE: New Biden WMD strategy includes small nuke reactors
SUMMARY: One of the emerging concerns for the administration is the small modular reactors that produce clean energy, but which account for a new proliferation risk.

TITLE: DeSantis, Pence allies launching campaign to speed energy approvals
SUMMARY: A new group aims to spend up to $10 million to sway Congress to loosen federal rules for both fossil fuel projects and green power. A major element: putting "the right pressure" on vulnerable Senate Democrats.

TITLE: 'We can’t find people to work': The newest threat to Biden's climate policies
SUMMARY: The companies trying to advance a new generation of clean-energy technologies face a struggle: Finding enough people to hire.

TITLE: Kerry to stay on as Biden's top climate diplomat
SUMMARY: Kerry's relationship with his Chinese counterpart, Xie Zhenhua, has been a rare bright spot between the United States and China.

TITLE: Why Russia's war is causing blackouts in Asia
SUMMARY: The fighting on Ukrainian battlefields has disrupted the supply of energy worldwide. Some of the biggest impacts are happening in countries far from the war.

TITLE: Air around East Palestine still has high chemical levels — but risk isn't 'imminent,' researchers say
SUMMARY: Some local residents have complained about unusual ailments such as bloody noses and dizziness.

TITLE: How American energy helped Europe best Putin
SUMMARY: Moscow bet its energy shipments to Europe would stifle the opposition to its invasion of Ukraine. Instead, it sparked a backlash that has dramatically altered global trade.

TITLE: EPA on Ohio derailment: Norfolk Southern will pay for everything
EPA orders Norfolk Southern to pay for train crash clean-up
SUMMARY: If the company doesn't complete any part of the plan, EPA will do it and charge Norfolk Southern three times the cost.

TITLE: ‘My kids are being poisoned’: How aviators escaped America’s war on lead
SUMMARY: Lead was removed from gasoline decades ago. So why is aviation fuel still laced with the metal — a neurotoxin tied to developmental problems in children?

TITLE: John Kirby denies U.S. sabotaged Nord Stream pipelines
SUMMARY: "It’s a completely false story. There is no truth it," Kirby said when asked about reporting by journalist Seymour Hersh alleging U.S. involvement.

TITLE: Surveillance video: Ohio train ignited sparks ahead of derailment
EPA chief promises results after Ohio train crash
SUMMARY: The derailment of the 150-car train sent several tankers carrying hazardous chemicals tumbling off the tracks in the 4,700-person village of East Palestine, Ohio.

TITLE: Dead fish spotted after Ohio train derailment causes toxic chemical spill
DeWine blames Ohio rail company for chemical spill: 'They should pay'
GOP's newest attack on Biden’s climate law: China
SUMMARY: GOP objections to Chinese involvement in clean-energy projects threaten to complicate the president's efforts to create a U.S.-based supply chain for green power.

TITLE: Ford to build EV battery plant in Michigan, use Chinese tech
SUMMARY: The $3.5 billion project will allow the company to take advantage of tax breaks in the Inflation Reduction Act, although it will utilize battery technology owned by a Chinese-based company.

TITLE: Watch: Ohio train derailment leads to massive flames, toxic fumes
EPA's refinery exemptions denial not subject to Congressional Review Act, GAO says
SUMMARY: The determination closes the door on potential efforts by lawmakers to use the law to undo the agency's action.

TITLE: How Biden's climate spending could transform Nevada
SUMMARY: Nevada is receiving billions of dollars in support from the Biden administration to boost electric vehicles and batteries, a development that is set to upend the state's economy and influence the nation's clean energy targets.

TITLE: Nevada Gov. Lombardo's awkward moment with Energy Secretary Granholm
What climate law? Voters clueless about Biden's top achievement
SUMMARY: The president is hitting the road to get the message out on the Inflation Reduction Act, an effort that may be crucial to his hopes for 2024.

TITLE: Europe moves from anger toward acceptance of U.S. climate law
SUMMARY: After meeting with U.S. officials, ministers from France and Germany said the need for Europe to respond with its own subsidy package is clearer than ever.

TITLE: China’s Mideast buildup stirs security worries for U.S.
SUMMARY: Chinese state-owned companies are making billions of dollars in investments near the Strait of Hormuz, one of the world's prime conduits for oil shipments — a move that could lay the groundwork for a future military presence.

TITLE: Shrinking Colorado River hands Biden his first climate brawl
SUMMARY: California, Arizona and Nevada are among the states at odds over how to divide the river's water — a fight among powerful political and economic interests with dire consequences.

TITLE: House GOP passes bill to curb Biden's use of oil reserve
SUMMARY: The bill is largely a messaging effort by Republicans.

TITLE: Republicans launch newest fight against Biden's oil drawdowns
SUMMARY: A bill to limit releases from the Strategic Petroleum Reserve seeks to blunt the political gains that Democrats have gained from lower gasoline prices.

TITLE: Big winners from Biden's climate law: Republicans who voted against it
SUMMARY: GOP lawmakers voted en masse against Biden’s signature bill. But roughly two-thirds of green-energy projects announced since it became law are going to Republican-held congressional districts, a POLITICO analysis found.

TITLE: 4 things to know about the gas stove frenzy
SUMMARY: The media storm surrounding gas stoves has shined a light on the environmental effects of the appliances and existing policies governing them. Here's what to know.
